extendedInfo.description: *** The app has been tested on Outlook Exchange 2007 and 2010. ****** Office 365 is now supported except ADFS ***Outlook Mobile Access Lite provides a streamlined, user friendly interface to access your Microsoft Outlook Web Access email via OWA.  Your emails and images are displayed conveniently on your mobile device, and the application has a simple and easy to use interface, much like that of the gmail application.Automatically log in to your account and notifications appear to keep you informed as to when new emails arrive. Simple and clear icons make it easy to carry out functions like:  Read, reply, reply to all and mail forwarding etc.Quickly share your photos and media on your device just as you would using social media tools like facebook and twitter, as a link to Outlook Mobile Access Lite appears in your share list.Actions are not carried out until your next synchronization or by hitting ârefreshâ, giving you the chance to undo your last actions if you happen to change your mind.Some of the features Outlook Mobile Access Lite lets you do include:- read and reply to emails- check emails on different folders- download and upload attachments- move email items between mail folders- select multiple email items to delete or move to your other folders- respond to invitations and meeting requests- view calendar appointment or meeting schedule- create / edit / delete appointment or meeting- appointment / meeting notifications- email notifications (support multiple labels)- create, delete and rename label- customize settings- multiple accounts supportedUnlike many other email applications, Outlook Mobile Access Lite enables you to do all these things in an uncluttered way.Any questions?  Please contact kmcchu@gmail.com

reviews.title: Loves to crash frequently
reviews.comment: The last update made the app unusable for about 2 months... looks like it is not crashing as frequently as it was.... then again... I lost continuity of checking mails in this... got used to mobile browser... complete waste of money
reviews.author: Vasishta Maharshi

reviews.title: Lmiller
reviews.comment: Was working great but latest update I\'m not getting notifications..... please fix
reviews.author: Lisa Miller

reviews.title: Great! Finally Howard outlook access
reviews.comment: Love this. I hope the dev works in my color flags from outlook and a more detailed monthly calendar,  but this app is great right out of the box!
reviews.author: Thomas Garcia

reviews.title: Got the app working
reviews.comment: Excellent app
reviews.author: Nathan Rourke

reviews.title: Refund please
reviews.comment: I won\'t open when I want it to. It says it stopped running then I send report to say it sucks and when I fire up my phone again the inbox is there. Moving emails to folders worked but does not show that it did (0) could only confirm that email was moved by going to email on desk top. Also no flag for follow up. That blows!
reviews.author: Jason de Villiers

reviews.title: \"application not licensed\"
reviews.comment: Was working great but just started bringing up a message that says \"application not licensed\" and won\'t let me into my email, says I didn\'t pay for it which I definitely did.
reviews.author: jacob peeters

reviews.title: Good app
reviews.comment: Great Works fine
reviews.author: Jon Simonarson

reviews.title: Not worth paying for buy touchdown instead
reviews.comment: I would advice people away from this app. It populates its own signature! I have clients missing information in emails as they thinks its finished because this app decides to put its own signature in the email half way through after I click send. You can\'t easily flag emails for follow up. Its an app not for business people.
reviews.author: Scott Hamilton

reviews.title: Has all the needed functions
reviews.comment: Gives notifications, opens attachments, full functionality... only a little slow.
reviews.author: Dr. Tarek Galal

reviews.title: Poor compared with IOS options
reviews.comment: Poor, but only decent one for droid.
reviews.author: Ben Skinner

reviews.title: Loving it!
reviews.comment: Have been used for a while. Very reliable. I like the function to view attachment on the app instead of downloading it. Good job. Worth full stars.
reviews.author: Anna Lam

reviews.title: Does the job.
reviews.comment: To view other folders tap app icon or blue star. Cannot view emails older than 6 days. Must manually refresh to get new emails. Can mark as junk or not junk, so worth another star.
reviews.author: Stephen Wright

reviews.title: Does the job very well
reviews.comment: Very useful app to check corporate email without having to give you company to wipe your device.  Developer is very reactive when problems arise.
reviews.author: Oren Recht

reviews.title: The best OWA Outlook Period!
reviews.comment: My company request that I setup exchange server to access email. Then they will require a digit password every time I unlock the phone, and they remove my ability to change certain security settings. They also want access to perform remote wipe if necessary. That is unacceptable. This app provides push notifications. And feels almost like a native app, yet it works with the OWA (over Web access) to access almost every feature. It also allows me to bypass and not have my company have any access to my Phone.
reviews.author: Robert Gross

reviews.title: Great!
reviews.comment: This app keeps getting better and the developer responds quickly to feedback and emails.
reviews.author: Erik Visser

reviews.title: It just works !!
reviews.comment: My company wants me to install one app for connection and another to use as an app. I discovered I can simply use a browser to do what I needed but it is in full format (as opposed to mobile format). Then I realize I can just set up an exchange account and use the built in email client but the admin policy forces me to use a 5 digit password instead of pattern. This simple app solves all my problems. On top of that the developer responded promptly to my issue and got it resolved within minutes (literally).
reviews.author: Daniel Chu

reviews.title: Adequate.
reviews.comment: It\'s lacking a lot of features. Calendars show military time, not AM/PM, outgoing messages aren\'t cached, so if they fail to send, there\'s no copy in your drafts folder, etc.
reviews.author: M Dodd

reviews.title: Connot connect to my work email
reviews.comment: Prompt response by developer. And once found that the app doesn\'t work for adds they refunded. Appreciate it!
reviews.author: Vishal Vinchurkar

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.comment: Great app. Does what it says on the box. Missing a few calendar features, but still a very useful app.
reviews.author: Daniel Andrew

reviews.title: Works great
reviews.comment: This app has greatly improved over time. Loaded with features and worth it. Constantly being updated
reviews.author: ja Pa
